intro: Leonotis schinzii, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking spikes of tubular red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
